answers.answer: For the first time in 5 years I am now seeing an endo.  My TSH levels were all over the place, so my doc said it was time to get the extra help an endo could give.  I am very happy with my decision.
It would be a good idea. The Synthroid dose was raised quite a bit- 50 to 175?. That may be too big of a jump. It would be best to titrate upward until the right dose is achieved.

I believe in going low and slow with med. dose and adjustments. At least no higher than 100mg.  Going too high with a dose can cause an over shoot of goal level, causing a ping pong effect. Some Endo. are just as guilty of this as well. If you do choose an Endo. pick one that is a thyroid specialist or at least one that deals with lots of thyroid patient per year.  Most Endos. deal in diabetes with thyroid way down their list of expresses.Good luck!GL,still no edit!
That was suppose to be "expertise" not expresses!GL,still no edit!

question: I have been on Synthroid for 6 weeks and my TSH level came down from 18.16 to 11.24.Do I need to see an endrocrinologist?  I was on 50 milligrams of Synthroid and now themy primary care doctor has raised it to 175 milligrams
title: High TSH
